div.p: Type of biological response examined in a total of 545 biological responses measured in 311 highly cited biological ocean change studies by subdiscipline in laboratory (a) and nonlaboratory (e.g., field, population modeling, paleobiology) settings (b), and specific theme (c). Number of biological responses are indicated in parentheses. A single study examined evolutionary adaptation via population growth in the laboratory (i.e., Lohbeck etÂ al., 2012), categorized as a response in abundance here.
